titleStmt.title: Thomas E. Bramlette to Daniel W. Lindsey
CWG13753

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 10; Folder 1864 Subsistence & Supplies, Lists of Stores Purchased & Transportation; Bundle 3

body.p:
UNITED WE STAND DIVIDED WE FALL
Commonwealth of Kentucky,
EXECUTIVE DEPARTMENT.
Frankfort Lexington Oct 20, 1864.
Maj Genl. D W Lindsey:

I learn that Col Graham has requested the revocation of Maj Morgans Coms. -- Take no action till my return. -- For sufficient reasons Col Grahams request must not be complied with, which I will expound on return

Lexington Ky
Oct 20th Ky
Bramlette Tho. E.
Understand that Col Graham has reqested the revocation of Maj Morgans Coms. Take no action until I return.
Recd A. G. O. 20" Oct 1864
